questions.question: Which of the following is a primary component of computer graphics?
questions.answer: b) GPU

questions.question: What does the term 'raster graphics' refer to?
questions.answer: b) Pixel-based images

questions.question: Which property of video display devices determines how long an image remains visible after being displayed?
questions.answer: a) Persistence

questions.question: What is the aspect ratio?
options: a) The ratio of vertical pixels to horizontal pixels
b) The ratio of screen width to screen height
c) The ratio of screen height to screen width
d) The ratio of screen diagonal to screen width
questions.answer: b) The ratio of screen width to screen height

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of anti-aliasing in computer graphics?
questions.answer: b) To improve image quality

questions.question: Which type of graphics is resolution-dependent?
questions.answer: a) Raster graphics

questions.question: What is the main advantage of vector graphics over raster graphics?
questions.answer: a) Scalability

questions.question: Which component of a computer graphics system stores pixel data for display?
questions.answer: a) Frame buffer

questions.question: What is the purpose of a clipping algorithm in computer graphics?
options: d) To adjust brightness and contrast
questions.answer: b) To remove hidden surfaces

questions.question: Which transformation is used to change the size of an object in computer graphics?
questions.answer: c) Scaling

questions.question: What does the term 'ray tracing' refer to?
questions.answer: c) Simulating light interactions

questions.question: Which type of projection is commonly used in 3D computer graphics?
questions.answer: b) Perspective projection

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Z-buffer in 3D rendering?
options: c) To perform hidden surface removal
questions.answer: c) To perform hidden surface removal

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for filling polygons in computer graphics?
questions.answer: c) Scanline algorithm

questions.question: What is the purpose of a texture map in computer graphics?
options: a) To add color to 3D models
questions.answer: b) To simulate surface details

questions.question: What is software engineering and why is it important?
options: a) The process of designing and building software systems
b) The study of computer hardware
c) The management of software projects
d) The development of video games
questions.answer: a) The process of designing and building software systems

questions.question: What are the phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC)?
options: a) Analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment, maintenance
c) Requirements gathering, coding, testing, documentation
questions.answer: a) Analysis, design, implementation, testing, deployment, maintenance

questions.question: What is the purpose of software testing?
options: a) To find and fix bugs in the code
questions.answer: a) To find and fix bugs in the code

questions.question: What is version control?
options: a) A technique for managing software licenses
b) A system for tracking changes to code over time
c) A method for optimizing database performance
d) A process for creating software requirements
questions.answer: b) A system for tracking changes to code over time

questions.question: What is the purpose of software documentation?
options: b) To explain how the code works
questions.answer: b) To explain how the code works

questions.question: What is a software requirement?
options: a) A description of how the software will be tested
b) A statement of what the software must do
c) A list of software features
questions.answer: b) A statement of what the software must do

questions.question: What is the waterfall model?
options: a) A model for managing software projects
b) A technique for optimizing database queries
c) A process for creating user interfaces
d) A method for tracking code changes
questions.answer: a) A model for managing software projects

questions.question: What is agile software development?
options: a) A method for creating user interfaces
b) A process for optimizing database performance
c) An iterative and flexible approach to software development
d) A technique for managing software licenses
questions.answer: c) An iterative and flexible approach to software development

questions.question: What is the purpose of a software design pattern?
options: c) To standardize solutions to common problems
questions.answer: c) To standardize solutions to common problems

questions.question: What is refactoring?
options: a) A technique for managing software licenses
b) A process for creating user interfaces
c) A method for tracking code changes
d) A way to improve code quality without changing its behavior
questions.answer: d) A way to improve code quality without changing its behavior

questions.question: What is the role of a software architect?
options: c) To design the overall structure of a software system
questions.answer: c) To design the overall structure of a software system

questions.question: What is a software bug?
options: a) A feature requested by the user
b) A defect or error in the code
questions.answer: b) A defect or error in the code

questions.question: What is continuous integration?
options: a) A technique for managing software licenses
b) A process for optimizing database performance
c) A method for tracking code changes
d) A practice of regularly merging code changes into a shared repository
questions.answer: d) A practice of regularly merging code changes into a shared repository

questions.question: What is an operating system?
options: a) The software that manages computer hardware resources
b) A type of application software
questions.answer: a) The software that manages computer hardware resources

questions.question: What is the purpose of an operating system?
options: a) To provide a user-friendly interface
b) To manage computer hardware and software resources
c) To create graphics for games
questions.answer: b) To manage computer hardware and software resources

questions.question: Which component of an operating system manages memory allocation?
questions.answer: a) Kernel

questions.question: What is a process in the context of an operating system?
questions.answer: a) A running application

questions.question: What is virtual memory?
questions.answer: c) A memory management technique

questions.question: What is a file system?
options: b) A way to organize files on disk
questions.answer: b) A way to organize files on disk

questions.question: What is a shell in the context of an operating system?
options: a) A protective layer for hardware components
b) A user interface for interacting with the OS
c) A type of file system
questions.answer: b) A user interface for interacting with the OS

questions.question: What is a device driver?
options: a) A type of application software
c) A program that allows the OS to communicate with hardware devices
questions.answer: c) A program that allows the OS to communicate with hardware devices

questions.question: What is the role of the scheduler in an operating system?
options: b) To create graphics for games
c) To allocate CPU time to processes
questions.answer: c) To allocate CPU time to processes

questions.question: What is a system call?
options: a) A request made by an application to the OS kernel
b) A type of file system
questions.answer: a) A request made by an application to the OS kernel

questions.question: What is the purpose of a bootloader?
options: a) To load applications into memory
c) To start the operating system
d) To create graphics for games
questions.answer: c) To start the operating system

questions.question: What is a deadlock?
options: a) A type of file system corruption
b) A situation where two or more processes are unable to proceed
questions.answer: b) A situation where two or more processes are unable to proceed

questions.question: What is the purpose of a command-line interface (CLI)?
options: a) To create graphics for games
b) To provide a user-friendly interface
c) To allow users to interact with the OS using text commands
questions.answer: c) To allow users to interact with the OS using text commands

questions.question: What is the role of the registry in Windows operating systems?
options: d) To create graphics for games
questions.answer: c) To store configuration settings

questions.question: What is optimization techniques?
options: a) The process of improving the performance of a computer program
b) The study of computer hardware
c) The management of software projects
d) The development of video games
questions.answer: a) The process of improving the performance of a computer program

questions.question: What are the common optimization techniques used in computer science?
questions.answer: d) All of the above

questions.question: What is the purpose of optimization?
questions.answer: b) To minimize resource usage

questions.question: What is the time complexity of an algorithm?
options: a) The amount of memory used by the algorithm
b) The number of instructions executed by the algorithm
c) The number of input elements processed by the algorithm
d) The maximum amount of time the algorithm takes to run
questions.answer: b) The number of instructions executed by the algorithm

questions.question: What is a graph in graph theory?
options: a) A visual representation of data
b) A set of nodes connected by edges
questions.answer: b) A set of nodes connected by edges

questions.question: What is a vertex (or node) in a graph?
options: a) A line connecting two points
b) A point in the graph
d) A type of data structure
questions.answer: b) A point in the graph

questions.question: What is an edge in a graph?
options: a) A line connecting two points
b) A point in the graph
d) A type of data structure
questions.answer: a) A line connecting two points

questions.question: What is the degree of a vertex in a graph?
options: a) The number of edges connected to the vertex
b) The number of nodes in the graph
c) The length of the longest path from the vertex
d) The number of connected components
questions.answer: a) The number of edges connected to the vertex

questions.question: What is a path in a graph?
options: a) A sequence of nodes connected by edges
c) A type of data structure
d) A point in the graph
questions.answer: a) A sequence of nodes connected by edges

questions.question: What is a cycle in a graph?
options: a) A sequence of nodes connected by edges
c) A type of data structure
d) A closed path in the graph
questions.answer: d) A closed path in the graph

questions.question: What is a connected graph?
options: a) A graph with no edges
b) A graph with only one vertex
c) A graph where there is a path between any pair of vertices
d) A graph with no cycles
questions.answer: c) A graph where there is a path between any pair of vertices

questions.question: What is a tree in graph theory?
options: a) A graph with no edges
b) A graph with only one vertex
d) A graph with no cycles
questions.answer: c) A connected acyclic graph

questions.question: What is a bipartite graph?
options: a) A graph with no edges
b) A graph with only one vertex
c) A graph with two disjoint sets of vertices
d) A graph with no cycles
questions.answer: c) A graph with two disjoint sets of vertices

questions.question: What is an Eulerian path?
options: a) A path that visits every vertex exactly once
b) A path that visits every edge exactly once
c) A path that starts and ends at the same vertex
d) A path that visits every vertex and edge exactly once
questions.answer: b) A path that visits every edge exactly once

questions.question: What is a Hamiltonian cycle?
options: a) A cycle that visits every vertex exactly once
b) A cycle that visits every edge exactly once
c) A cycle that starts and ends at the same vertex
d) A cycle that visits every vertex and edge exactly once
questions.answer: a) A cycle that visits every vertex exactly once

questions.question: What is a planar graph?
options: a) A graph with no edges
b) A graph that can be drawn on a plane without edges crossing
c) A graph with only one vertex
d) A graph with no cycles
questions.answer: b) A graph that can be drawn on a plane without edges crossing
